markdown: ###### Major Positive reputation with the [Huana](/huana/) | rewardname2 = Don't reveal the black market | reward2 = | rewardname3 = | reward3 = | rewardname4 = | reward4 = | rewardname5 = | reward5 = | rewardname6 = | reward6 = | prev = | conc = Delver's Row (quest) | next = The Last Sanctuary | internalname = FCT_QST_01_Black_Market | guid = a1f8f22d-5468-4753-8877-e627ac0d1023 }} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [faction quest](/pillarsOfEternityIiDeadfireQuestsFactionQuests/) in {{poe2}}. ## Synopsis [Prince Aruihi](/princeAruihi/) has discovered evidence of a black market in the Roparu district of the city known as the Gullet. He wants to know how it is being supplied. Someone in the Gullet ought to know a way to Delver's Row. Showing the prince's medallion might attract the attention of a prospective buyer in the black market. ## Walkthrough * Talk to the Prince to begin the quest. He gives you [The Envoy's Badge](/theEnvoysBadge/), a token of Vailian dignitary. It can be used in a couple of different instances: ** To get information from [Fyrna](/fyrna/) in [The Hole](/theHole/) regarding the location of [Delver's Row](/delversRow/). ** By showing it to [Ernezzo](/ernezzo/), a Vailian shopkeeper in Delver's Row, you can be granted free passage to [Dereo's Lair](/dereosLair/). * This quest is intertwined with [Delver's Row (quest)](/delversRowQuest/). Reaching the Row will update it automatically, while realizing that the Roparu are smuggling goods into [the Gullet](/theGullet/) through the [Undercroft](/undercroft/) provides you with information for the Prince. * Gain access to the [Undercroft](/undercroft/) by starting [The Cornett's Call](/theCornettsCall/) for [Dereo](/dereoTheLean/). After completing the first part of the quest and retrieving the [Cornett of Waves](/cornettOfWaves/), Dereo will grant you passage down via the lift in Delver's Row. Alternatively you can kill the lift guards and force your way through. * Upon entering the Undercroft, you learn that the [Principi](/principiSenPatrena/) pirates are smuggling goods via the lower city with the help of the [Watershapers](/watershapersGuildFaction/). Return to the Prince to report your findings. ** With [Diplomacy](/diplomacy/) 3, you can convince the Prince to leave Delver's Row alone, in order to keep the Roparu happier. ** When you reveal the involvement of the Watershapers, you can also use [Streetwise](/streetwise/) 6 to suggest better funding for the Guild to prevent them from seeking opportunities like this one. {{-}} ## Journal {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="3" style="word-break:break-all" | Quests/XX_Huana_Faction_Questline/FCT_QST_01_Black_Market.quest |- ! width="40px" | {{tooltip|ID|Objectives: 0, Descriptions: 10000, Addenda: 20000, End states: 30000, Alternate descriptions: 40000}} ! colspan="2" | Objectives |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''0''' | colspan="2" | '''Trade Secrets''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10000 | Prince Aruihi has discovered evidence of a black market in the Roparu district of the city known as the Gullet. He wants to know how it is being supplied. |- | rowspan="7" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''2''' | colspan="2" | '''Locate Delver's Row.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10002 | Someone in the Gullet ought to know a way to Delver's Row. Showing the prince's medallion might attract the attention of a prospective buyer in the black market. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20002 | I gained access to Delver's Row through the Narrows in the Gullet, where it was hidden behind a merchant stall. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20003 | Dereo the Lean sounds like the authority in Delver's Row. Getting closer to him might help me understand how the black market functions. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20010 | I've learned that Delver's Row is located somewhere in the Narrows - a tunnel system in the west of the Gullet. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20016 | To find Delver's Row I need to enter the Narrows, turn right, then continue forward until I see the merchant stall. The entrance to Delver's Row is concealed in the stall. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20018 | Enoi told me that someone at The Hole in the Gullet might know how to reach Delver's Row. |- | rowspan="7" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''3''' | colspan="2" | '''Reach the Undercroft.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10003 | The Undercroft is the source of contraband in Delver's Row. If I visited this guarded underbelly, I could learn more about how black market goods are being transported into the city. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20004 | Dereo has given me permission to enter the Undercroft via the lift in Delver's Row. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20005 | While reading the soul of a dead Roparu in the Gullet, I glimpsed a subterranean dock beneath the city. This was likely the Undercroft, which he accessed via a lift in Delver's Row. Delver's Row itself can be found through a secret door located behind an empty merchant stall in the Narrows. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20007 | I encountered some thugs in Delver's Row guarding a lift. It might be a route to the Undercroft. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20009 | I've been informed of a secret passage in the Old City that leads to a ruined temple. Inside that temple is a back door to the Undercroft. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20017 | Dereo can get me to the Undercroft, but only if I do him a favor first by retrieving the Cornett of Waves. |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''4''' | colspan="2" | '''Report to Prince Aruihi.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10004 | It seems that the Roparu reached an agreement with a group of pirates. Black market goods are smuggled into Neketaka through a small inlet in the Undercroft. What's more, the ships are guided with the aid of watershaping. This is information the prince will want to hear. He'll be waiting for me in the throne room of the palace in Serpent's Crown. |- | rowspan="5" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''9''' | colspan="2" | '''Travel to the Gullet.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10009 | My investigation begins at the Gullet, which lies southeast of Periki's Overlook. There I might uncover evidence of Delver's Row, the secretive locus of the black market. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20014 | The prince suggested that I recruit Tekēhu, a member of the Watershapers Guild in Periki's Overlook. Tekēhu has his own suspicions and might prove to be a useful asset. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20015 | The prince suggested that I bring Tekēhu with me. He might provide useful insights in my search for the black market. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20019 | Tekēhu has agreed to join me. |- | rowspan="9" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''12''' | colspan="2" | '''Investigate Delver's Row.''' |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 10012 | I've located Delver's Row, but I still don't know how the black market is supplied. Showing the prince's medallion to any of the merchants could offer me a lead to more information. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20008 | I can find Dereo's hideout by leaving Delver's Row, taking an immediate right, a left, and then another left. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20006 | I convinced Ernezzo to point me in the right direction. Dereo the Lean is the highest authority in Delver's Row, and Ernezzo has agreed to make the introductions. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20011 | A merchant named Ernezzo handles the pricier goods in Delver's Row. He might be interested in the medallion. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20013 | Ernezzo handled the pricier contraband before he died. Someone by the name of Dereo would be the man to speak with, but I would need to establish myself in Neketaka's underbelly to grab his attention. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20017 | Dereo can get me to the Undercroft, but only if I do him a favor first by retrieving the Cornett of Waves. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20003 | Dereo the Lean sounds like the authority in Delver's Row. Getting closer to him might help me understand how the black market functions. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20020 | Ernezzo died before I could learn anything useful from him. I'll have to find out how the black market is supplied from another source. |- ! colspan="3" | Unused strings |- | rowspan="2" style="vertical-align:text-top; text-align:center" | '''-''' | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20000 | Tekēhu has been killed. I doubt Prince Aruihi will take the news well. |- | style="vertical-align:text-top" | 20001 | I decided to leave Tekēhu behind. I can sort out this problem on my own. |- ! colspan="3" | End states |- | style="text-align:center" | {{cross}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30000 | Someone critical to this quest has been killed |- | style="text-align:center" | {{cross}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30001 | After I killed several members of the Watershapers Guild, Prince Aruihi wants no more to do with me. He threatened to throw me into exile and imprisonment if I returned. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30002 | I lied to the prince and convinced him that Delver's Row does not exist. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30003 | I told the prince about the smuggling operation in the Undercroft. Delver's Row will eventually be shut down. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30004 | I told the prince about the smuggling operation in the Undercroft, but I convinced him to leave Delver's Row alone for the time being. |- | style="text-align:center" | {{check}} | style="vertical-align: text-top" | 30005 | I told the prince how I massacred the Príncipi smugglers. He was taken aback by my initiative but not entirely displeased. |}
raw: {{Infobox quest poe2 | name = Trade Secrets | image = 06 SI Undercroft Introduction 02.png | caption = | added_in = poe2 | quest_type = Faction quest | quest_region = Neketaka - The Gullet | quest_level = 5 | faction = Huana | locations = Kahanga Palace;The Gullet;Delver's Row;Undercroft | main_npcs = | companion = Tekēhu | quest_giver = Prince Aruihi | xp_amount = 1000 | xp_type = Normal | xp_level = 5 | xp_weights = 1;1;1;1;1 | rewardname1 = Reveal the black market | reward1 = {{cp2|1500}};Major Positive reputation with the [[Huana]] | rewardname2 = Don't reveal the black market | reward2 = | rewardname3 = | reward3 = | rewardname4 = | reward4 = | rewardname5 = | reward5 = | rewardname6 = | reward6 = | prev = | conc = Delver's Row (quest) | next = The Last Sanctuary | internalname = FCT_QST_01_Black_Market | guid = a1f8f22d-5468-4753-8877-e627ac0d1023 }} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [[Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire quests#Faction quests|faction quest]] in {{poe2}}. ==Synopsis== [[Prince Aruihi]] has discovered evidence of a black market in the Roparu district of the city known as the Gullet. title: Trade Secrets
